name: Spiny Lizard
description: Named for its scales, which taper to a point and are raised in the center. It exhibits various color forms, from brownish to blue-green, all featuring a dark collar on the neck.
spread_note: Arid regions of the southwestern North America and northern Central America
food_note: Plant parts, small animals (mainly insects), fruits, buds, and other plant components
image_alt: Spiny lizard, photo: Petr Velenský, Prague Zoo
proportions: Length 18–30 cm, with the tail comprising more than half; weight 50 g
attractions: It excels at climbing rocks, bushes, and trees. Females can lay eggs multiple times per season.
breeding: Breeding of this species began in 2004 with the opening of the Africa Up Close pavilion. Its success is evidenced by over 400 hatched offspring.
